description: Strand units: Spatial awareness, 2-D shapes, 3-D shapes, Symmetry and Angles

teaching.topicContent: Introduce triangular prisms as 3-D shapes with triangular bases and rectangular sides. Discuss the properties of triangular prisms, such as faces, edges, and vertices. Explore the relationship between triangular prisms and their constituent 2-D shapes.

Introduce pyramids as 3-D shapes with polygonal base and triangular sides meeting at a vertex. Discuss the different types of pyramids, such as square pyramids and triangular pyramids.  Explore the symmetry, properties, and practical applications of pyramids.

Introduce spheres as perfectly round 3-D shapes with no corners or edges. Discuss the unique properties of spheres, such as surface area and volume.Identify real-world examples of spheres, such as balls and fruits.

Introduce cylinders as 3-D shapes with circular bases and curved sides.  Compare cylinders to other 3-D shapes in terms of their attributes.  Explore the use of cylinders in everyday objects, such as cans and cups..

Reinforce the properties of cubes and cuboids, which were mentioned earlier.  Discuss how a cube is a special type of cuboid with all sides equal. Explore patterns and designs using cubes and cuboids.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Exploring the World of 3-D Shapes
teaching.topicContent: Present various 3-D shapes not covered earlier, such as octahedron and dodecahedron.  Discuss their properties, including faces, edges, and vertices.    Encourage students to recognize these shapes in everyday objects..

Provide students with nets of different 3-D shapes, including those mentioned earlier.  Have them construct the shapes using paper folding and assembly techniques.  Discuss how 2-D shapes form the basis of 3-D shapes.

Provide building materials like toothpicks and marshmallows or playdough. Challenge students to build 3-D structures using various shapes.Explore stability, symmetry, and creativity in their constructions.

Present a collection of 3-D shapes, including those mentioned earlier. Have students sort the shapes based on shared attributes like the number of faces or vertices. Encourage discussions about similarities and differences.

teaching.topicTitle: Lesson: Practical Problem Solving with 3-D Shapes
teaching.topicContent: Pose real-world problems involving 3-D shapes and their applications. Students work individually or in groups to solve problems related to volume, surface area, and design.  Discuss different strategies for approaching these problems.
